New Records: Jason Holder posted career-best T20 figures of 4 for 7
Key Match Events: Chris Jordan and Adil Rashid added 36 runs off 29 balls to move England safely past their lowest T20I total
Jason Holder picked off Saqib Mahmood with a slower ball and bowling Rashid to finish with figures of 4 for 7
Brandon King and Shai Hope in the middle, West Indies raced to 50 runs inside nine overs
Rashid made the breakthrough in the 10th over, wrong-footing Hope to set up a stumping for Billings
King (52 from 49) and Pooran (27 off 29) steered their side home with 17 balls to spare
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies headed into the series in poor form, winning just nine of their 26 T20Is since the start of 2021
England, T20 World Cup semi-finalists, are the No.1 ranked side in the format
Post-Match Reflections: Scarcely breaking a sweat, King and Pooran steered their side home with 17 balls to spare, a confidence-boosting win nonetheless
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies won by nine wickets
England were bowled out for 103 in a dismal performance with the bat
